intro: Alsine corymbulosa, commonly known as the clustered alsike, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Alsine corymbulosa is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments.
